nodes.bodyText: That is a pretty heavy replacement, perhaps make a small utility function instead?
You could simplify it to only accept a single char instead of a string for the suffix.
Are you sure it is safe to not ignore case?
Yes, I am. I thought about it twice.
Looking at the annotations favoriteTitle seems to be non null, so inverting would help you to get rid of the null-check
I would split of a method for this especially as it occurs twice
We only have to remove a single one so maybe we should not inline the complete implementation of stripEnd
stripEnd isn't the same as removeEnd.

Thanks for your review @martinvw. I did not change this one. It probably will not happen very often but I remember darkly the there was a reason for me to do it like this. The stripEnd method will not only remove on trailing character - it will remove all occurrences of the suffix at the end.
